A plant is any organism of the kingdom Plantae, which includes the flowering plants, conifers and other gymnosperms, ferns, clubmosses, hornworts, liverworts, mosses and the green algae. Historically, plants formed one of two kingdoms covering all living things that were not animals, and both algae and fungi were treated as plants.

A fern is a member of a group of vascular plants that reproduce via spores and have neither seeds nor flowers. They differ from mosses by being vascular, i.e., having specialized tissues that conduct water and nutrients and in having life cycles in which the sporophyte is the dominant phase.

The hosta is a genus of plants commonly known as hostas, plantain lilies and occasionally by the Japanese name giboshi. Hostas are widely cultivated as shade-tolerant foliage plants.
A tree is a perennial plant with an elongated stem, or trunk, supporting branches and leaves in most species.
